    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"

>
[Safe House](/Feats.aspx?ID=2086) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 196 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) A vigilante's Safe House, can be located in any city or near any lodge they have received a Pathfinder briefing. A vigilante can use their downtime to relocate their safe house. A vigilante can use their safe house only if it is in the town or location where their current adventure is taking place._

**Archetype** [Vigilante](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=80)

**Prerequisites**
[Vigilante Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2083)

</column>

---

You establish a safe house—a secure space in which to hide your secrets from the outside world. This safe house is roughly the size of a 10-foot cube. It's in a location you have access to, and it can be part of a larger building or structure, like a hidden room or an underground cave. The safe house protects objects and people inside it from magical detection. This has the effects of [_nondetection_](/Spells.aspx?ID=209), using your [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) modifier for the [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) DC and half your level rounded up for the counteract level. Setting up or moving your safe house takes a week of downtime. The size of the safe house expands to four 10-foot cubes if you're an expert in Deception, eight cubes if you're a master, and 16 cubes if you're legendary.
